channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: The ‘Stranger Things’ Brothers on Resolving Relationships and Character Closure
item.description: Before hitting the endgame, 'Stranger Things' had to tie off some threads and help the Hawkins gang get their heads in the game.

item.title: Great news! Nvidia finally has a 72GB graphics card — but since it's the RTX Pro 5000 Blackwell, it will probably cost you just a bit more than a 64GB DDR5 stick <sarcasm>
item.description: Nvidia RTX Pro 5000 Blackwell offers 72GB memory, 14,080 CUDA cores, and high compute throughput, challenging workstation pricing comparisons.

item.title: Samsung aims to beat Apple's $5000 Display XDR monitor with 6K 3D monitor — and it doesn't even need glasses
item.description: Samsung’s Odyssey 3D G90XH brings glasses-free 6K visuals with eye tracking, while G8 and OLED models offer versatile resolutions.

item.title: Tesla-style retractable door handles will be banned in China
item.description: China is banning Tesla-style door handles as U.S. regulators look into safety issues too.

item.title: LG is preparing a 1500-nit 39-inch 5K curved monitor that's almost as bright as Apple's Pro Display XDR — but at a fraction of the price
item.description: LG Display’s 39-inch 5K Tandem WOLED promises high peak brightness, modest pixel density gains, gentler curvature, and unresolved performance details.

item.title: Asus is set to launch a 2-in-1 convertible rugged laptop for creators with unique dial control, a backlit keyboard, and even a dedicated case
item.description: Asus ProArt GoPro Edition targets creators with a convertible design, AI StoryCube app integration, dial control, a backlit keyboard, and dedicated GPU support.

item.title: Apple escalates its appeal of a $2 billion fine from a UK antitrust lawsuit
item.description: Apple isn't ready to pay a several billion-dollar fine to UK App Store users and is filing an appeal over a major antitrust lawsuit. As first reported by The Guardian, Apple has requested to appeal to the UK's Court of Appeal, which would escalate the case beyond the Competition Appeal Tribunal (CAT). The latest appeal attempt follows an October decision from the CAT, where the court found that Apple engaged in anticompetitive practices by exploiting its dominant market position with the App Store to charge higher fees. The CAT's ruling established a £1.5 billion, or roughly $2 billion, fine,...

item.title: A guide to choosing the right Apple Watch
item.description: The gap between Apple's standard and budget smart watches has never felt smaller.

item.title: In the pantheon of new home appliances, the Roborock F25 Ultra is unequivocally my favorite product of 2025
item.description: The Roborock F25 Ultra doesn't sound glam, but it has transformed my cleaning game.

item.title: 8GB of VRAM could be all you can find in laptop GPUs soon — but is it enough? I tested the MSI Katana 15 HX to find out
item.description: I was left quite surprised at the MSI Katana 15HX B14W's gaming performance, but I'm slightly worried about how long 8GB GPUs will last.

item.title: Attackers Caused So Much Havoc Inside Rainbow Six Siege, Ubisoft Shut Down the Whole Game
item.description: Let's hope there's no lasting damage to the in-game economy.

item.title: Prime Video May Expand ‘Fallout’ With a Reality Show Spinoff
item.description: Do you like the 'Fallout' games or show enough to watch a competition show based on 'Fallout Shelter'?

item.title: You need to read the subversive cosmic horror novella The Ballad of Black Tom
item.description: Things that HP Lovecraft was good at: Creating a mythos. Building atmosphere. Things that HP Lovecraft was bad at: Writing dialog. Creating compelling characters. Not being a racist. As a fan of horror in general, I can't pretend that Lovecraft isn't an important touchstone. But the man's blatant racism is also impossible to ignore, especially […]
